result.execSummary:
The defendant Julie A Lenart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Negligent Operation of Motor Vehicle, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Julie A Lenart

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
2:11 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Erik Johnson.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Johnson - DA is amending to reckless driving with a forfeiture and costs and will plea to negligent operation of motor vehicle with a fine and costs.  DA concurs.  Defendant concurs.  Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the defendant guilty to amended charge of reckless driving and imposes a $200 forfeiture plus costs.  Atty Johnson and defendant has received a copy of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged on 2016CM87.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Johnson.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-$100 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Processing.

Court adjourned at 2:20 p.m.
